title: Symmetric monoidal category
summary: In category theory, a branch of mathematics, a symmetric monoidal category is a monoidal category (i.e. a category in which a "tensor product" ⊗ {\displaystyle \otimes } is defined) such that the tensor product is symmetric (i.e. A ⊗ B {\displaystyle A\otimes B} is, in a certain strict sense, naturally isomorphic to B ⊗ A {\displaystyle B\otimes A} for all objects A {\displaystyle A} and B {\displaystyle B} of the category). One of the prototypical examples of a symmetric monoidal category is the category of vector spaces over some fixed field k, using the ordinary tensor product of vector spaces.
